title: 'All the cakes melted and I was fired': 16-year-old mercifully fired from a toxic frozen sweets shop after following the contradictory orders of 2 bickering managers
description: Your first job is a crash course in the workforce, and usually by "crash," I mean you're doomed to crash and burn somehow. No teenager is just born with the work ethic and the business perspective of their older counterparts, so when company drama unfolds, it's their first time navigating this type of thing.Â This teenager learned quickly how important it is to communicate with both your schedule manager and the owner of the company. After getting caught in the crosshairs of a nightmarish communication scuffle, this teenager was spared the continued employment under inefficient and under-qualified managers. Lucky for them, they were taught a valuable lesson in the workforce before getting set free to find a new job under better managers.
author: Jesse Kessenheimer
excerpt: 'All the cakes melted and I was fired': 16-year-old mercifully fired from a toxic frozen sweets shop after following the contradictory orders of 2 bickering managers - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: My first job was at an ice cream shop, too. I was 15-years-old, bright-eyed and bushy-tailed, and I scored the job because my best friend worked there first. I was allowed to eat one ice cream per shift, which I happily did, but I learned that I could lure groups of other high school friends into the shop under the guise of handing out 1 free ice cream to the gang. Sure, I was giving away my company's comped snack, but I was selling 5 more ice creams in the process! My boss didn't like my marketing tactic and fired me on the spot, but I know in my heart that he missed out on an excellent employee.
